paragraphs.body: This egg custard tart was smuggled through the ${link_0} by the ${link_1} tribe.
paragraphs.text: This egg custard tart was smuggled through the Great Divide by the Zhang tribe.

paragraphs.body: The egg custard tart is a ${link_0} widely coveted by ${link_1} ${link_2}, and it was also popular among the Air Nomads. As the name implies, the tart is a baked pastry filled with egg custard.
paragraphs.text: The egg custard tart is a dessert widely coveted by Earth Kingdom citizens, and it was also popular among the Air Nomads. As the name implies, the tart is a baked pastry filled with egg custard.

paragraphs.body: While traversing the ${link_0} together with the ${link_1} and the ${link_2}, ${link_3} discovered both tribes had smuggled food in defiance of the ${link_4}'s warnings. His outrage at this discovery dissipated, however, when he noticed that the Zhang tribe had brought at least one egg custard tart with them, the glimpse reminding him of how hungry he was. After successfully escaping the canyon, he asked where that custard tart was, stating he was "starving".
paragraphs.text: While traversing the Great Divide together with the Zhangs and the Gan Jins, Aang discovered both tribes had smuggled food in defiance of the canyon guide's warnings. His outrage at this discovery dissipated, however, when he noticed that the Zhang tribe had brought at least one egg custard tart with them, the glimpse reminding him of how hungry he was. After successfully escaping the canyon, he asked where that custard tart was, stating he was "starving".

paragraphs.body: The egg tart is a real-life dish that was introduced into China in the 20th century. An adaptation of the Portuguese pastel de nata, in which a round crust is filled with egg custard and baked, it came into mainland China via the colony of Macau.
paragraphs.text: The egg tart is a real-life dish that was introduced into China in the 20th century. An adaptation of the Portuguese pastel de nata, in which a round crust is filled with egg custard and baked, it came into mainland China via the colony of Macau.
